intro: Plutarchia ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian plume, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
